isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - REMOVE - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: Place transmission in the vertical position. Put a block under the clutch housing to prevent damage to the input shaft.
Remove the four bolts and the auxiliary countershaft rear bearing cover and gasket ( Figure 32).

figure.caption: Figure 32. Remove Bolts and Auxiliary Countershaft Rear Bearing Cover

caution.para: Auxiliary countershaft retaining straps must be installed to prevent the countershafts from falling out of the auxiliary housing.

step1.para: Install an auxiliary countershaft retaining strap with two bolts removed from the auxiliary countershaft bearing covers ( Figure 33). Install a 3/8" by 2-1/2" bolt through the center of the auxiliary countershaft retaining strap. Thread bolt into auxiliary countershaft (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 33. Install Auxiliary Countershaft Retaining Strap

note.para: Do not use an air gun. Tighten only until the bolts are snug.

step1.para: Repeat Steps 2 and 3 for the other auxiliary countershaft.
Remove the 15 bolts that hold the auxiliary section to the transmission case ( Figure 34).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Remove Bolts Holding Auxiliary Section to Transmission Case

note.para: There are two lengths of bolts; note their location.

step1.para: Install an output shaft hanger bracket and attach a chain hoist. Pull the auxiliary section off and remove the gasket ( Figure 35).

note.para: The auxiliary section can be removed in the horizontal position. The procedure is the same.

step1.para: If the transmission is set in the horizontal position, after removing the 15 bolts, insert three puller screws in the tapped holes of the housing flange. Tighten evenly to move the auxiliary section back ( Figure 36); leave a space wide enough to attach a chain hoist. Remove the puller screws and attach a chain hoist to the auxiliary section. Pull the auxiliary section off and remove the gasket.

figure.caption: Figure 36. Insert Puller Screws in Housing Flange and Tighten
